Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Donor \Do"nor\, n. [F. donneur, OF. daneor, fr. donner. See {Donee}, and cf. {Donator}.] 1. One who gives or bestows; one who confers anything gratuitously; a benefactor. Inverse of recipient. [1913 Webster]
2. (Law) One who grants an estate; in later use, one who confers a power; -- the opposite of donee. --Kent. [1913 Webster]
Touching, the parties unto deeds and charters, we are to consider as well the donors and granters as the donees or grantees. --Spelman. [1913 Webster]
donor n 1: person who makes a gift of property [syn: {giver}, {presenter}] 2: (medicine) someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person (the host)
